wikipedia_page.main: Isabella Kelly, née Fordyce, also Isabella Hedgeland (1759–1857) was a Scottish novelist and poet. Her novels have been said to resemble those of Ann Radcliffe.

response: *June 25 – Isabella Kelly, Scottish novelist and poet (born 1759)
*Isabella Kelly – Collection of Poems and Fables
*May 4 (baptism) – Isabella Kelly, Scottish novelist and poet (died 1857)

Kelly was born in London, the son of Robert Hawke Kelly (died in or before 1807), a captain in the Royal Navy. His mother was the novelist Isabella Kelly, daughter of Captain William Fordyce, Groom of the Privy Chamber to George III. In 1824, he was called to the bar by Lincoln's Inn, having already gained a reputation as a skilled special pleader.
* June 25 – Isabella Kelly (born 1759), Scottish-born novelist and poet
Twice during the Jacobite risings, in 1715 and 1745, the government used Cairnsburgh to house troops. In 1759 it was the birthplace of author Isabella Kelly.Stewart (2007), 210.
* 4 May (baptism) – Isabella Kelly, novelist and poet (died 1857 in London)
